Then r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚â§r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\leq r(s,a)+\gamma% \cdot\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}u(s^{\prime})italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚â§ italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ).

    Let us evaluate ùíØ‚àó‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØ‚àó‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)superscriptùíØùë£ùë†superscriptùíØùë¢ùë†\mathcal{T}^{*}v(s)-\mathcal{T}^{*}u(s)caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) and see what happens :

    ùíØ‚àó‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØ‚àó‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)superscriptùíØùë£ùë†superscriptùíØùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\mathcal{T}^{*}v(s)-\mathcal{T}^{*}u(s)~{}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) =maxùëé‚Å¢[r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)]‚àímaxùëé‚Å¢[r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)]absentùëédelimited-[]ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëédelimited-[]ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\underset{a}{\max}\left[r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}% |s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right]-\underset{a}{\max}\left[r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}% _{s^{\prime}|s,a}u(s^{\prime})\right]= underitalic_a start_ARG roman_max end_ARG [ italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - underitalic_a start_ARG roman_max end_ARG [ italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]
    ‚â§maxùëé‚Å¢([r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)]‚àí[r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)]‚èü‚â§0)absentùëéabsent0‚èüdelimited-[]ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤delimited-[]ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\underset{a}{\max}\Big{(}\underset{\leq~{}~{}0}{\underbrace{% \left[r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right]-\left[% r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}u(s^{\prime})\right]}}\Big{)}‚â§ underitalic_a start_ARG roman_max end_ARG ( start_UNDERACCENT ‚â§ 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG [ italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - [ italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] end_ARG end_ARG )
    ùíØ‚àó‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØ‚àó‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)superscriptùíØùë£ùë†superscriptùíØùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\mathcal{T}^{*}v(s)-\mathcal{T}^{*}u(s)~{}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) ‚â§0absent0\displaystyle\leq~{}~{}0‚â§ 0
    ‚áíùíØ‚àó‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚áíabsentsuperscriptùíØùë£ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}^{*}v(s)~{}~{}‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) ‚â§ùíØ‚àó‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚Å¢‚àÄsabsentsuperscriptùíØùë¢ùë†for-allùë†\displaystyle\leq~{}~{}\mathcal{T}^{*}u(s)~{}~{}~{}\forall~{}s‚â§ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) ‚àÄ italic_s (4.2.4)

‚àé

Now, using the Banach Contraction Principle as refined by the Proposition 4.1.3, we can conclude that, the Bellman Optimality Operator ùíØ‚àósuperscriptùíØ\mathcal{T}^{*}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on (ùí±,||‚ãÖ||‚àû)(\mathcal{V},||\cdot||_{\infty})( caligraphic_V , | | ‚ãÖ | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) has the following behaviors :

  • ‚Ä¢

    ùíØ‚àósuperscriptùíØ\mathcal{T}^{*}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT has a unique fixed point f‚àó‚ààùí±superscriptùëìùí±f^{*}\in\mathcal{V}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_V.

  • ‚Ä¢

    For any starting point (function) f0subscriptùëì0f_{0}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can find the fixed point f‚àósuperscriptùëìf^{*}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by looking for the convergence of the sequence defined by fn+1=ùíØ‚Å¢fnsubscriptùëìùëõ1ùíØsubscriptùëìùëõf_{n+1}=\mathcal{T}f_{n}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_T italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.
    Also, the fixed point that we will find will be the optimal value function, since it‚Äôll be the maximum (in fact, this sequence is monotonically increasing by our definition of the problem).

This fixed point f‚àósuperscriptùëìf^{*}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the overall optimal value function because here the equation use exactly the optimal policy œÄ‚àósuperscriptùúã\pi^{*}italic_œÄ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.
We can, in the same way, define the operator for action-value functions.

4.2.3 Definition.

As we know, the Bellman Optimality equation for Q-values (Relation 3.2.6) is given by this expression :

q‚àó‚Å¢(s,a)=r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚ãÖmaxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢q‚àó‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)subscriptùëûùë†ùëéùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤‚ãÖùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëésuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùëûsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤q_{*}(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)\cdot\underset{% a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}{q_{*}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

Now, giving the same MDP ‚Ñ≥‚Ñ≥\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, let ùí¨ùí¨\mathcal{Q}caligraphic_Q be the space of bounded real-valued functions over ùíÆ√óùíúùíÆùíú\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}caligraphic_S √ó caligraphic_A.
We can also define, point-wise, the Bellman Optimality Operator for the Q-Value ùíØQ‚àó:Q‚ÜíQ:subscriptsuperscriptùíØùëÑ‚ÜíùëÑùëÑ\mathcal{T}^{*}_{Q}:Q\rightarrow Qcaligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_Q ‚Üí italic_Q as follows :

(ùíØQ‚àó‚Å¢f)‚Å¢(s,a)‚â°r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤[p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚ãÖmaxa‚Ä≤‚ààùíú‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)]‚Å¢‚àÄf‚ààùí¨subscriptsuperscriptùíØùëÑùëìùë†ùëéùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤delimited-[]‚ãÖùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëésuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤ùíúsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤for-allùëìùí¨\left(\mathcal{T}^{*}_{Q}f\right)(s,a)\equiv r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime% }}\left[p(s^{\prime}|s,a)\cdot\underset{a^{\prime}\in\mathcal{A}(s^{\prime})}{% \max}f(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right]~{}~{}~{}\forall f\in\mathcal{Q}( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â° italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_A ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ‚àÄ italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_Q (4.2.5)

The same properties can be stated for this Bellman optimality operator for the Q-value, using the same kind of proofs.
The Bellman optimality operators as defined here are particular cases of what we will refer to as Bellman Expectation Operators. In this context, we considered the scenario of selecting the action that maximises the expected reward, without consideration of alternative policies. We now consider the policy in more general terms. This does not lead only to the optimal value function, but also to the value function corresponding to the chosen policy.

4.3 Bellman Expectation Operators

We will start with the state-value Bellman Expectation Operator. We know that, the Bellman Expectation equation is given by the Relation 3.1.15 :

vœÄ‚Å¢(s)=‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚Å¢vœÄ‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤))subscriptùë£ùúãùë†subscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùúãsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤v_{\pi}(s)=\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{% \prime}|s,a)v_{\pi}(s^{\prime})\right)italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )

We can define by analogy the Bellman Expectation Operator by :

(ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢f)‚Å¢(s)=‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤))‚Å¢‚àÄf‚ààùí±subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùëìùë†subscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤for-allùëìùí±\left(\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}f\right)(s)=\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(r(s,a)+% \gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)f(s^{\prime})\right)~{}~{}\forall f% \in\mathcal{V}( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) ( italic_s ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ‚àÄ italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V (4.3.1)
4.3.1 Proposition.

We claim that, the operator ùíØvœÄsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, as defined by the Expression 4.3.1 is :

  1. 1.

    A Œ≥‚àílimit-fromùõæ\gamma-italic_Œ≥ -contraction mapping.

  2. 2.

    A monotonic mapping.

Proof.

Let consider two value functions uùë¢uitalic_u and vùë£vitalic_v in ùí±ùí±\mathcal{V}caligraphic_V.

  1. 1.

    Let us compute the absolute value between the transformations of those two functions and see what happens :

    |ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)|subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | =|‚àëaœÄ(a|s)‚ãÖ(Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p(s‚Ä≤|s,a)u(s‚Ä≤)‚àíŒ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p(s‚Ä≤|s,a)v(s‚Ä≤))|\displaystyle=\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s% ^{\prime}|s,a)u(s^{\prime})-\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)v(s^{% \prime})\right)\right|= | ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ|‚àëaœÄ(a|s)‚ãÖ(‚àës‚Ä≤p(s‚Ä≤|s,a)u(s‚Ä≤)‚àí‚àës‚Ä≤p(s‚Ä≤|s,a)v(s‚Ä≤))|\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s% ^{\prime}|s,a)u(s^{\prime})-\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)v(s^{\prime})% \right)\right|= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ|‚àëaœÄ(a|s)‚ãÖ(ùîºs‚Ä≤|s,au(s‚Ä≤)‚àíùîºs‚Ä≤|s,av(s‚Ä≤))|\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{% \prime}|s,a}u(s^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right)\right|= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖmaxs‚Ä≤‚Å¢|u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚àív‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)|absent‚ãÖùõæsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s^{\prime}}{\max}\left|u(s^{\prime})-v(s% ^{\prime})\right|‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) |
    ‚áí|ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)|‚áíabsentsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u% (s)\right|‚áí | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖmaxùë†‚Å¢|u‚Å¢(s)‚àív‚Å¢(s)|absent‚ãÖùõæùë†ùë¢ùë†ùë£ùë†\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s}{\max}\left|u(s)-v(s)\right|‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ underitalic_s start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) |
    ‚áímaxùë†‚Å¢|ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)|‚áíabsentùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow\underset{s}{\max}\left|\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-% \mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)\right|‚áí underitalic_s start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖ‚Äñu‚Å¢(s)‚àív‚Å¢(s)‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptnormùë¢ùë†ùë£ùë†\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u(s)-v(s)||_{\infty}‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ‚áí‚ÄñùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚Äñ‚àû‚áíabsentsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)|% |_{\infty}‚áí | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖ‚Äñu‚Å¢(s)‚àív‚Å¢(s)‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptnormùë¢ùë†ùë£ùë†\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u(s)-v(s)||_{\infty}‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u ( italic_s ) - italic_v ( italic_s ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (4.3.2)

    This proves that the Bellman Expectation Operator for the state value function is a contraction mapping.

  2. 2.

    Let us now prove the monotonicity :
    Assume that u‚Å¢(s)‚â§v‚Å¢(s)ùë¢ùë†ùë£ùë†u(s)\leq v(s)italic_u ( italic_s ) ‚â§ italic_v ( italic_s ) in all states, then we will get :

    ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë£ùë†\displaystyle\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) =Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(ùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚àíùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤))absent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤subscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }u(s^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a}v(s^{\prime})\right)= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(ùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢(u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚àív‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤))‚èüu‚Å¢(s)‚â§v‚Å¢(s)‚Å¢‚àÄs)absent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢ùë†ùë£ùë†for-allùë†‚èüùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }\underset{u(s)\leq v(s)~{}\forall s}{\underbrace{\left(u(s^{\prime})-v(s^{% \prime})\right)}}\right)= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_u ( italic_s ) ‚â§ italic_v ( italic_s ) ‚àÄ italic_s end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG end_ARG )
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(ùîºs‚Ä≤|s,a‚Å¢(u‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)‚àív‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤)))‚â§0absent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùîºconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùë¢superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë£superscriptùë†‚Ä≤0\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(\mathbb{E}_{s^{\prime}|s,a% }\left(u(s^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime})\right)\right)\leq 0= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) ‚â§ 0
    ‚áíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚àíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚áíabsentsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë£ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)-\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) ‚â§0absent0\displaystyle\leq 0‚â§ 0
    ‚áíùíØvœÄ‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s)‚áíabsentsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë¢ùë†\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}u(s)‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s ) ‚â§ùíØvœÄ‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s)‚Å¢i.e. ùíØvœÄ is a monotonic mappingabsentsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£ùë£ùë†i.e. ùíØvœÄ is a monotonic mapping\displaystyle\leq\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}v(s)~{}~{}~{}\text{i.e. $\mathcal{T}^{% \pi}_{v}$ is a monotonic mapping}‚â§ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s ) i.e. caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a monotonic mapping (4.3.3)

‚àé

From the properties we‚Äôve just proven, using the Banach Contraction Principle as refined in the Proposition 4.1.3, we can conclude that :

  • ‚Ä¢

    ùíØvœÄsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùë£\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{v}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has a unique fixed point fœÄ‚ààùí±superscriptùëìùúãùí±f^{\pi}\in\mathcal{V}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_V.

  • ‚Ä¢

    For any starting point f0subscriptùëì0f_{0}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can find the fixed point fœÄsuperscriptùëìùúãf^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by looking for the convergence of the sequence defined by fn+1œÄ=ùíØ‚Å¢fnœÄsuperscriptsubscriptùëìùëõ1ùúãùíØsuperscriptsubscriptùëìùëõùúãf_{n+1}^{\pi}=\mathcal{T}f_{n}^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_T italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

This fixed point fœÄsuperscriptùëìùúãf^{\pi}italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the optimal value function with respect to the policy œÄùúã\piitalic_œÄ we are following.

4.3.2 Remark.

For the action value function, the Bellman Expectation Operator ùíØQœÄsubscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùëÑ\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{Q}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the Bellman Optimality Operator ùíØQ‚àósubscriptsuperscriptùíØùëÑ\mathcal{T}^{*}_{Q}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined by the Expression 4.2.5 have exactly the same properties.
Note also that, the Bellman Expectation Operator, by analogy with the formula 3.1.16 is given by :

(ùíØQœÄ‚Å¢f)‚Å¢(s,a)=r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚Å¢(‚àëa‚Ä≤œÄ‚Å¢(a‚Ä≤|s‚Ä≤)‚ãÖf‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))subscriptsuperscriptùíØùúãùëÑùëìùë†ùëéùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëésubscriptsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤‚ãÖùúãconditionalsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\left(\mathcal{T}^{\pi}_{Q}f\right)(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(% s^{\prime}|s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{% \prime},a^{\prime})\right)( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (4.3.4)

Here we have presented in a condensed way, the Bellman Operators. Now, we are able to say precisely how the Reinforcement Learning algorithms work really. This is why, in the following section, we are talking about the policy evaluation and policy iteration methods but now in the operator setting and knowing all the properties of those operators, it shows us why the RL algorithm come to work.

4.4 Policy evaluation and iteration in operators setting

From these properties (of the Bellman Operator), we can now deduce two ways of searching for the state-value function and the best policy. There are the well-known foundational policy evaluation and policy improvement (but this last one will be illustrated through policy iteration) algorithms (as presented in the previous chapter) :

  1. 1.

    Policy evaluation :
    The policy evaluation, is a method used to find the true state-value function associated to an MDP while following a specific policy. It‚Äôs based on the properties of the Bellman operator. Starting from a random distribution of value functions, until reaching the true one as follows :

    • ‚Ä¢

      Start with v0subscriptùë£0v_{0}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT a random initial value function

    • ‚Ä¢

      Update the value function using : vk+1‚ÜêTœÄ‚Å¢vk‚Üêsubscriptùë£ùëò1superscriptùëáùúãsubscriptùë£ùëòv_{k+1}\leftarrow T^{\pi}v_{k}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üê italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    By the Banach Fixed-point Principle, it will converge to vœÄsubscriptùë£ùúãv_{\pi}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as k‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëòk\rightarrow\inftyitalic_k ‚Üí ‚àû

  2. 2.

    Policy iteration :
    The policy iteration algorithm is used to find the best policy, by updating concurrently the policy (policy improvement) as well as the associated value-functions. It is done in the following way :

    • ‚Ä¢

      Start with a random policy œÄ0subscriptùúã0\pi_{0}italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    • ‚Ä¢

      Concurrent iterations :

      • *

        Policy evaluation : vk+1‚ÜêTœÄi‚Å¢vk‚Üêsubscriptùë£ùëò1superscriptùëásubscriptùúãùëñsubscriptùë£ùëòv_{k+1}\leftarrow T^{\pi_{i}}v_{k}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üê italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

      • *

        Policy improvement : Greedily improve the policy using : œÄi+1=a‚Å¢r‚Å¢g‚Å¢m‚Å¢a‚Å¢xa‚ààùíú‚Å¢(s)‚Å¢qœÄi‚Å¢(s,a)subscriptùúãùëñ1ùëéùíúùë†ùëéùëüùëîùëöùëéùë•subscriptùëûsubscriptùúãùëñùë†ùëé\pi_{i+1}=\underset{a\in\mathcal{A}(s)}{argmax~{}}q_{\pi_{i}}(s,a)italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_a ‚àà caligraphic_A ( italic_s ) end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_a italic_r italic_g italic_m italic_a italic_x end_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a )

    Again, using the Banach Fixed-point Principle, it will converge to the best policy œÄùúã\piitalic_œÄ and the associated value function vœÄsubscriptùë£ùúãv_{\pi}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as k‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëòk\rightarrow\inftyitalic_k ‚Üí ‚àû.

This is sufficient to justify how Reinforcement Learning algorithms work because it explains how the two foundational methods work.

Chapter Conclusion

In this chapter we have talked about Bellman operators. We first presented the Bellman optimality operators (for both the state and the state-action value functions), before presenting a general formulation via the Bellman expectation operators (again for both the state and the state-action value functions). We have shown that these operators are Œ≥‚àílimit-fromùõæ\gamma-italic_Œ≥ -contraction and monotonic mappings, i.e. they have only one fixed point and that fixed point is the optimum. This is very important because it justifies why and how RL algorithms work from a fundamental point of view. In the next chapter we will now discuss some limitations of the Bellman operators in their classical expression and show some alternatives that seem interesting, even if they require further investments.

Chapter 5 Contributions, implementations and analysis

In this chapter we discuss some limitations of the classical Bellman operators as introduced in the previous chapter. We present how we have to make a trade-off between optimality and efficiency, and finally we show some practical results that we have obtained through experiments, which suggest that we need to think more about some refinements that should be made either to the Bellman operators or to the associated value functions.

5.1 Alternatives to the Bellman Operator

As we have seen, value-based reinforcement learning algorithms solve decision making problems through iterative application of a convergent operator, and an initial value function is recursively improved. Many other research works have examined alternatives to the Bellman operator [4, 6, 8, 11, 23, 42], but there are two which seem to be more promising, this is the reason why we will take inspiration from them. The first one is the consistent Bellman Operator [8], and the second one is the family of Robust Stochastic Operators [23]. These two operators appear to be more interesting than those suggested before [23], but for the second, we‚Äôll suggest a refinement of it which will remain good (we postulate) even without the stochasticity, improving the stability.

5.1.1 Motivation [8, 23]

The motivation for new expressions of the Bellman Operator is simple. While Q-learning based methods continue to be successfully used in RL to determine the optimal policy, there is always a need to improve the convergence speed, accuracy and robustness of these algorithms. Now considering the fact that most of the time there are intrinsic error approximation (for example in the usual case of using discrete MDP to approximate a continuous system), the optimal state-action value function obtained through the Bellman operator does not always describe the value of stationary policies. And most importantly, when the differences between the optimal state-action value function and the suboptimal state-action value functions are small, this can lead to errors in identifying the true optimal actions. This is why, even if the classical Bellman Operators can solve problems in a perfect discrete setting, we need to refine it to be general because we know that for many real-world problems of our interest, discrete-time systems come from approximating continuous systems. So, there is always an intrinsic error, thus a need to integrate the corrector in the Operator.
Let us now study the effectiveness of the two aforementioned operators and find some insights on the general method of determining optimal policies in RL.

5.1.2 The Consistent Bellman Operator

This operator, is primarily defined by the authors of [8] for the action-value function. Here is the definition :

ùíØc‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s,a)=r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚ãÖ[ùïÄ{s‚â†s‚Ä≤}‚Å¢maxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)+ùïÄ{s=s‚Ä≤}‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s,a)]‚Å¢with f‚ààùí¨subscriptùíØùëêùëìùë†ùëéùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤‚ãÖùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëédelimited-[]subscriptùïÄùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤ùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùïÄùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëìùë†ùëéwith f‚ààùí¨\mathcal{T}_{c}f(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)% \cdot\left[\mathbb{I}_{\{s\neq s^{\prime}\}}\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}f(s^% {\prime},a^{\prime})+\mathbb{I}_{\{s=s^{\prime}\}}f(s,a)\right]~{}~{}~{}\text{% with $f\in\mathcal{Q}$}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ‚ãÖ [ blackboard_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_s ‚â† italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + blackboard_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_s = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) ] with italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_Q (5.1.1)

Knowing that ùïÄùïÄ\mathbb{I}blackboard_I is the indicator function, we claim also that, the following properties holds for the consistent Bellman Operator given by the Expression 5.1.1 :

  1. 1.

    ùíØcsubscriptùíØùëê\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a contraction mapping,

  2. 2.

    ùíØcsubscriptùíØùëê\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is monotonic.

Proof.

First, let‚Äôs do some refinements :

  • ‚Ä¢

    We will replace for simplicity

    ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚ãÖ(f)‚Å¢ by ‚Å¢ùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(f)subscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤‚ãÖùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëéùëì by subscriptùîº‚Ñôùëì\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|s,a)\cdot(f)\text{~{}~{}~{}~{}by~{}~{}~{}~{}}% \mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}(f)‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_f ) by blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f )
  • ‚Ä¢

    We will refine the action-value function as follows :

    fs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)={f‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)ifs‚â†s‚Ä≤f‚Å¢(s,a)ifs=s‚Ä≤‚Å¢for‚Å¢f‚ààùí¨subscriptùëìùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤casesùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤ifùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëìùë†ùëéifùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤forùëìùí¨f_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lcl}f(s^{\prime},a^{\prime% })&\text{if}&s\neq s^{\prime}\\ f(s,a)&\text{if}&s=s^{\prime}\\ \end{array}~{}~{}~{}\text{for}~{}~{}~{}f\in\mathcal{Q}\right.italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ARRAY start_ROW start_CELL italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL if end_CELL start_CELL italic_s ‚â† italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) end_CELL start_CELL if end_CELL start_CELL italic_s = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARRAY for italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_Q (5.1.2)

Now we can rewrite the consistent operator in 5.1.1 as follows :

ùíØc‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s,a)=r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢[maxa‚Ä≤‚Å°fs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)]‚Å¢with f‚ààùí¨subscriptùíØùëêùëìùë†ùëéùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîº‚Ñôdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùëìùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤with f‚ààùí¨\mathcal{T}_{c}f(s,a)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left[\max_{a^{% \prime}}~{}f_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right]~{}~{}~{}\text{with $f\in% \mathcal{Q}$}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] with italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_Q (5.1.3)

We can now start the proof :

  1. 1.

    Let u,v‚ààùí¨ùë¢ùë£ùí¨u,v\in\mathcal{Q}italic_u , italic_v ‚àà caligraphic_Q, we will have :

    |ùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)|subscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëésubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | =|Œ≥‚ãÖùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(maxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))‚àíŒ≥‚ãÖùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(maxb‚Ä≤‚Å¢vs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,b‚Ä≤))|absent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîº‚Ñôsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîº‚Ñôsuperscriptùëè‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëè‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\left|\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{a^{% \prime}}{\max}~{}u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)-\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{b^{\prime}}{\max}~{}v_{s}(s^{\prime},b^{\prime})% \right)\right|= | italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) - italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ|ùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(maxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))‚àíùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(maxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢vs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))|absent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîº‚Ñôsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùîº‚Ñôsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\left|\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\underset{a^{% \prime}}{\max}~{}u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)-\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}% \left(\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)\right|= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖ|maxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢ùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)‚àívs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))|absent‚ãÖùõæsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùîº‚Ñôsubscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\left|\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right|‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖmaxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢|ùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)‚àívs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))|absent‚ãÖùõæsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùîº‚Ñôsubscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left|\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right|‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) |
    ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖmaxs‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤‚Å¢|us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)‚àívs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)|absent‚ãÖùõæsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{s^{\prime},a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left|u_{% s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right|‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) |
    =Œ≥‚ãÖmaxs,a‚Å¢|us‚Å¢(s,a)‚àívs‚Å¢(s,a)|absent‚ãÖùõæùë†ùëésubscriptùë¢ùë†ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùë†ùë†ùëé\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot\underset{s,a}{\max}~{}\left|u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)\right|= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_s , italic_a end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) |
    =Œ≥‚ãÖ‚Äñus‚Å¢(s,a)‚àívs‚Å¢(s,a)‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptnormsubscriptùë¢ùë†ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùë†ùë†ùëé\displaystyle=\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}= italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ‚áí|ùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)|‚áíabsentsubscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëésubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow\left|\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)\right|‚áí | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖ‚Äñus‚Å¢(s,a)‚àívs‚Å¢(s,a)‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptnormsubscriptùë¢ùë†ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùë†ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ‚áí‚ÄñùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)‚Äñ‚àû‚áíabsentsubscriptnormsubscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëésubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)||_{\infty}‚áí | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖ‚Äñus‚Å¢(s,a)‚àívs‚Å¢(s,a)‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõæsubscriptnormsubscriptùë¢ùë†ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùë†ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot||u_{s}(s,a)-v_{s}(s,a)||_{\infty}‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (5.1.4)
  2. 2.

    Now, for us to prove the monotonicity, we have to consider two state-action value functions uùë¢uitalic_u and vùë£vitalic_v such that u‚Å¢(s,a)‚â§v‚Å¢(s,a)‚Å¢‚àÄ(s,a)‚ààùíÆ√óùíúùë¢ùë†ùëéùë£ùë†ùëéfor-allùë†ùëéùíÆùíúu(s,a)\leq v(s,a)~{}~{}\forall(s,a)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â§ italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚àÄ ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚àà caligraphic_S √ó caligraphic_A. From the definition we gave through the Expression 5.1.2, this also means that us‚Å¢(s,a)‚â§vs‚Å¢(s,a)subscriptùë¢ùë†ùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùë†ùë†ùëéu_{s}(s,a)\leq v_{s}(s,a)italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â§ italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ). Based now on the proof we just provided for the monotonicity, we have :

    ùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)subscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëésubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â§Œ≥‚ãÖmaxa‚Ä≤‚Å¢(ùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(us‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)‚àívs‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))‚èüus‚â§vs)absent‚ãÖùõæsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùîº‚Ñôsubscriptùë¢ùë†subscriptùë£ùë†‚èüsubscriptùë¢ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤subscriptùë£ùë†superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤\displaystyle\leq\gamma\cdot\underset{a^{\prime}}{\max}~{}\left(\mathbb{E}_{% \mathbb{P}}\underset{u_{s}\leq v_{s}}{\underbrace{\left(u_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})-v_{s}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)}}\right)‚â§ italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_max end_ARG ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG ( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG end_ARG )
    ‚áíùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)‚áíabsentsubscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëésubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)-\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â§0absent0\displaystyle\leq 0‚â§ 0
    ‚áíùíØc‚Å¢u‚Å¢(s,a)‚áíabsentsubscriptùíØùëêùë¢ùë†ùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{c}u(s,a)‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â§ùíØc‚Å¢v‚Å¢(s,a)‚Å¢‚àÄu,v‚ààùí¨formulae-sequenceabsentsubscriptùíØùëêùë£ùë†ùëéfor-allùë¢ùë£ùí¨\displaystyle\leq\mathcal{T}_{c}v(s,a)~{}~{}~{}\forall~{}u,v\in\mathcal{Q}‚â§ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚àÄ italic_u , italic_v ‚àà caligraphic_Q (5.1.5)

‚àé

From this proof, we can conclude that ùíØcsubscriptùíØùëê\mathcal{T}_{c}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has only one fixed point and that fixed point is optimal for this setup (that is the setup in which we are using the consistent Bellman equation instead of the classical one).
The question that remains is how this fixed point relates to the one we have found using the classical Bellman operator.
The most important thing is that, we are sure to converge to a unique fixed-point. As we don‚Äôt yet have the mathematical tool to say something about the relation between that fixed point and the one which will be found using the classical Bellman Operator, we can just wait and see how the operator will behave in practice in comparison to the Bellman Operator.

5.1.3 Modified Robust Stochastic Operator

Here, the proposed operator take inspirations in both the articles [23] and [8] but mostly that former article. This is more general (expectation operator) and different from the Robust Stochastic Operator suggested in [23].
We know that, as an RL algorithm get better, if we express vœÄ‚Å¢(s)subscriptùë£ùúãùë†v_{\pi}(s)italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) by :

vœÄ‚Å¢(s)=‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖqœÄ‚Å¢(s,a),subscriptùë£ùúãùë†subscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùëûùúãùë†ùëév_{\pi}(s)=\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot q_{\pi}(s,a),italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) ,

the difference that we will call advantage learning, given by

A‚Å¢(s,a)=qœÄ‚Å¢(s,a)‚àívœÄ‚Å¢(s),ùê¥ùë†ùëésubscriptùëûùúãùë†ùëésubscriptùë£ùúãùë†A(s,a)=q_{\pi}(s,a)-v_{\pi}(s),italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) = italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ,

always gives an idea on how well is our policy (which should be learning how to often choose better actions) as well as the value function. The quantity |A‚Å¢(s,a)|ùê¥ùë†ùëé\left|A(s,a)\right|| italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) | should get smaller as we are learning the good policy.
Now, let‚Äôs say we modify the Bellman Expectation Operator for the action-value function as defined by the Relation 4.3.4 in such a way that we integrate the idea of the advantage learning directly in the Bellman Operator instead of waiting applying it in the learning process as for some policy gradient methods [15]. Now, if we call that new operator ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it will be defined for all f‚ààùí¨ùëìùí¨f\in\mathcal{Q}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_Q as follows :

(ùíØa‚Å¢f)=r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖ‚àës‚Ä≤p‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤|s,a)‚Å¢(‚àëa‚Ä≤œÄ‚Å¢(a‚Ä≤|s‚Ä≤)‚ãÖf‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))+Œ≤‚ãÖ[f‚Å¢(s,a)‚àí‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚Å¢f‚Å¢(s,a)]‚èüA‚Å¢(s,a)‚Å¢: advantage learningsubscriptùíØùëéùëìùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëùconditionalsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùë†ùëésubscriptsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤‚ãÖùúãconditionalsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤superscriptùë†‚Ä≤ùëìsuperscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤‚ãÖùõΩùê¥ùë†ùëé: advantage learning‚èüdelimited-[]ùëìùë†ùëésubscriptùëéùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùëìùë†ùëé\left(\mathcal{T}_{a}f\right)=r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\sum_{s^{\prime}}p(s^{\prime}|% s,a)\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}|s^{\prime})\cdot f(s^{\prime},a^{% \prime})\right)+\beta\cdot\underset{A(s,a)\text{:~{}advantage learning}}{% \underbrace{\left[f(s,a)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)f(s,a)\right]}}( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ) = italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s , italic_a ) ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_f ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ start_UNDERACCENT italic_A ( italic_s , italic_a ) : advantage learning end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG [ italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) italic_f ( italic_s , italic_a ) ] end_ARG end_ARG (5.1.6)

We can now study the properties of the operator defined by this Expression 5.1.6. The coefficient Œ≤ùõΩ\betaitalic_Œ≤ is any real now but we will define it properly at the end of this theoretical investigation.

5.1.4 Proposition.

The operator ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as defined by the Relation 5.1.6 is not a contraction mapping.

Proof.

Let u‚Å¢(s,a)‚â°uùë¢ùë†ùëéùë¢u(s,a)\equiv uitalic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â° italic_u and v‚Å¢(s,a)‚â°vùë£ùë†ùëéùë£v(s,a)\equiv vitalic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚â° italic_v be two elements of ùí¨ùí¨\mathcal{Q}caligraphic_Q :

|ùíØa‚Å¢u‚àíùíØa‚Å¢v|subscriptùíØùëéùë¢subscriptùíØùëéùë£\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{T}_{a}u-\mathcal{T}_{a}v\right|| caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | =|Œ≥ùîº‚Ñô(‚àëa‚Ä≤œÄ(a‚Ä≤|s‚Ä≤)(u(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)‚àív(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤)))+Œ≤[(u‚àív)‚àí‚àëaœÄ(a|s)(u‚àív)]|\displaystyle=\left|\gamma\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^% {\prime}|s^{\prime})\left(u(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})-v(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})% \right)\right)+\beta\left[(u-v)-\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)(u-v)\right]\right|= | italic_Œ≥ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_u ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_v ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) + italic_Œ≤ [ ( italic_u - italic_v ) - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ( italic_u - italic_v ) ] |
>Œ≤‚ãÖ|u‚Å¢(s,a)‚àív‚Å¢(s,a)|‚Å¢for some couples (u,v) and Œ≤absent‚ãÖùõΩùë¢ùë†ùëéùë£ùë†ùëéfor some couples (u,v) and Œ≤\displaystyle>\beta\cdot\Big{|}u(s,a)-v(s,a)\Big{|}~{}~{}~{}\text{for some % couples $(u,v)$~{} and ~{} $\beta$}> italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ | italic_u ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_v ( italic_s , italic_a ) | for some couples ( italic_u , italic_v ) and italic_Œ≤
‚áí‚ÄñùíØa‚Å¢u‚àíùíØa‚Å¢v‚Äñ‚àû‚áíabsentsubscriptnormsubscriptùíØùëéùë¢subscriptùíØùëéùë£\displaystyle\Rightarrow||\mathcal{T}_{a}u-\mathcal{T}_{a}v||_{\infty}‚áí | | caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u - caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT >Œ≤‚ãÖ‚Äñu‚àív‚Äñ‚àûabsent‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptnormùë¢ùë£\displaystyle>\beta\cdot||u-v||_{\infty}> italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ | | italic_u - italic_v | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (5.1.7)

So, as we can see, whatever Œ≤ùõΩ\betaitalic_Œ≤ will be, there exist situations where the operator ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is not a contration. ‚àé

Since the operator ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is not a contraction, we cannot assess its convergence. But, even if we are not sure about the convergence, we can still say something about its behavior. For that, inspired by the definitions given in [23, 8], let‚Äôs define two important properties that we will call the properties of a well-behaving operator. There are the optimality preservation and the gap increasing properties.
Note : in the following definitions, we‚Äôll change a little bit our conventions by writing value functions in capital letters. This will help us to write properly operators as indices.

5.1.5 Definition (Optimality preservation).

Let call ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT an alternative to the Bellman operator and ùíØbsubscriptùíØùëè\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the classical Bellman operator. We will say that ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT preserves the optimality property if :

Qk,ùíØb<Vk,ùíØb‚áíQk,ùíØa<Vk,ùíØawhen k‚Üí‚àûformulae-sequencesubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëè‚áísubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëésubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëéwhen k‚Üí‚àûQ_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}<V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}~{}~{}~{}~{}\text{when $k\to\infty$}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚áí italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT when italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû

Qk,ùíØsubscriptùëÑùëòùíØQ_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the action value function that we find at the iteration kùëòkitalic_k, using the operator ùíØùíØ\mathcal{T}caligraphic_T and Vk,ùíØsubscriptùëâùëòùíØV_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the associated state value function.

5.1.6 Definition (Gap increasing).

Using the same notation as previously, we will say that an alternative operator ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to the Bellman one ùíØbsubscriptùíØùëè\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT induces the gap increasing property if, for each state s‚ààùíÆùë†ùíÆs\in\mathcal{S}italic_s ‚àà caligraphic_S and each feasible action in that state a‚ààùíú‚Å¢(s)ùëéùíúùë†a\in\mathcal{A}(s)italic_a ‚àà caligraphic_A ( italic_s ) :

|limk‚Üí‚àû[Qk,ùíØb‚àíVk,ùíØb]|‚â§|limk‚Üí‚àû[Qk,ùíØa‚àíVk,ùíØa]|subscript‚Üíùëòdelimited-[]subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscript‚Üíùëòdelimited-[]subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëésubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëé\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|\leq\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | ‚â§ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] |

Knowing that at each state, Vk,ùíØsubscriptùëâùëòùíØV_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an average of all Qk,ùíØsubscriptùëÑùëòùíØQ_{k,\mathcal{T}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that we can get by making a certain action from that state.

The optimality preservation and the gap increasing properties represent respectively :

  • ‚Ä¢

    How well the operator is likely to behave while looking for the fixed point and,

  • ‚Ä¢

    How is the model able to differentiate the values of suboptimal actions with those for optimal actions.

5.1.7 Proposition.

We claim that, the operator defined by the Expression 5.1.6, even if it is not a contraction, is both optimality preserving and gap increasing.

Proof.

Let‚Äôs prove those properties in the same order :

  1. 1.

    Optimality preservation : We know that Qk,ùíØ=ùíØ‚Å¢Qk‚àí1subscriptùëÑùëòùíØùíØsubscriptùëÑùëò1Q_{k,\mathcal{T}}=\mathcal{T}Q_{k-1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_T italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Vk,ùíØb=‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s).B‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)formulae-sequencesubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëéùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}=\displaystyle\sum_{a}\pi(a|s).Bell(Q_{k-1})italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) . italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Now, using the Definition 5.1.5, we assume that Qk,ùíØb<Vk,ùíØbsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëèQ_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and we will deduce the relation between Qk,ùíØasubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëéQ_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Vk,ùíØasubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëéV_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. To make the notation easy to manage, we will do this replacement :

    r‚Å¢(s,a)+Œ≥‚ãÖùîº‚Ñô‚Å¢(‚àëa‚Ä≤œÄ‚Å¢(a‚Ä≤|s‚Ä≤)‚ãÖQk‚àí1‚Å¢(s‚Ä≤,a‚Ä≤))=B‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)ùëüùë†ùëé‚ãÖùõæsubscriptùîº‚Ñôsubscriptsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤‚ãÖùúãconditionalsuperscriptùëé‚Ä≤superscriptùë†‚Ä≤subscriptùëÑùëò1superscriptùë†‚Ä≤superscriptùëé‚Ä≤ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1r(s,a)+\gamma\cdot\mathbb{E}_{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{a^{\prime}}\pi(a^{\prime}% |s^{\prime})\cdot Q_{k-1}(s^{\prime},a^{\prime})\right)=Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)italic_r ( italic_s , italic_a ) + italic_Œ≥ ‚ãÖ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Now we can start (knowing that we are working with k‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëòk\to\inftyitalic_k ‚Üí ‚àû) :

    Qk,ùíØbsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëè\displaystyle Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,ùíØbabsentsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëè\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ‚áíùíØb‚Å¢Qk‚àí1‚áíabsentsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëÑùëò1\displaystyle\Rightarrow\mathcal{T}_{b}Q_{k-1}‚áí caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,ùíØbabsentsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëè\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)‚áíabsentùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)‚áí italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    without a loss of generality, let K=mina‚Å°(Qk‚àí1‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíVk‚àí1‚Å¢(s))ùêæsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÑùëò1ùë†ùëésubscriptùëâùëò1ùë†K=\min_{a}{\Big{(}Q_{k-1}(s,a)-V_{k-1}(s)\Big{)}}italic_K = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ). Then

    B‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1\displaystyle Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖK‚áíabsentùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæ\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K‚áí italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖK‚ãÖ1absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæ1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K\cdot 1< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K ‚ãÖ 1
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖK‚áíabsentùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæ\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K‚áí italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖK‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæsubscriptùëéùúãconditionalùëéùë†\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K\cdot% \sum_{a}\pi(a|s)< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s )
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖK‚áíabsentùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæ\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot K‚áí italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖKabsentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêæ\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot K< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_K

    we know that K‚â§‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚Å¢(s,a)‚àíVk‚àí1‚Å¢(s))‚Å¢‚àÄ(s,a)‚ààùíÆ√óùíúùêæsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùëÑùëò1ùë†ùëésubscriptùëâùëò1ùë†for-allùë†ùëéùíÆùíúK\leq\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}(s,a)-V_{k-1}(s)\right)~{}~{}\forall~{}% (s,a)\in\mathcal{S}\times\mathcal{A}italic_K ‚â§ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a ) - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) ‚àÄ ( italic_s , italic_a ) ‚àà caligraphic_S √ó caligraphic_A, and when k‚Üí‚àû‚Üíùëòk\to\inftyitalic_k ‚Üí ‚àû as we are getting better policy, we have almost surely that (Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)‚â§‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)subscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1subscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)\leq\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â§ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    B‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖKùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩùêæ\displaystyle Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot Kitalic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ italic_K <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖKabsentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêæ\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot K< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_K
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)‚áíabsentùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1\displaystyle\Rightarrow Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k% -1}\right)‚áí italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\sum_{a% }\pi(a|s)\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    ‚áíB‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)‚èüQk,ùíØa‚áíabsentsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëé‚èüùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1\displaystyle\Rightarrow\underset{Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}}{\underbrace{Bell\left% (Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot\left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)}}‚áí start_UNDERACCENT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under‚èü start_ARG italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG end_ARG <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖ[B‚Å¢e‚Å¢l‚Å¢l‚Å¢(Qk‚àí1)+Œ≤‚ãÖ(Qk‚àí1‚àíVk‚àí1)]absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†delimited-[]ùêµùëíùëôùëôsubscriptùëÑùëò1‚ãÖùõΩsubscriptùëÑùëò1subscriptùëâùëò1\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot\Big{[}Bell\left(Q_{k-1}\right)+\beta\cdot% \left(Q_{k-1}-V_{k-1}\right)\Big{]}< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ [ italic_B italic_e italic_l italic_l ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_Œ≤ ‚ãÖ ( italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
    ‚áíQk,ùíØa‚áíabsentsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}‚áí italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <‚àëaœÄ‚Å¢(a|s)‚ãÖQk,ùíØa‚Å¢(s,a)absentsubscriptùëé‚ãÖùúãconditionalùëéùë†subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëéùë†ùëé\displaystyle<\sum_{a}\pi(a|s)\cdot Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}(s,a)< ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_a | italic_s ) ‚ãÖ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_a )
    ‚áíQk,ùíØa‚áíabsentsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëé\displaystyle\Rightarrow Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}‚áí italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT <Vk,ùíØaas k‚Üí‚àûabsentsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëéas k‚Üí‚àû\displaystyle<V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}~{}\text{as $k\to% \infty$}< italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû (5.1.8)
  2. 2.

    Gap increasing : Using the Definition 5.1.6, we have now to show that :

    |limk‚Üí‚àû[Qk,ùíØb‚àíVk,ùíØb]|‚â§|limk‚Üí‚àû[Qk,ùíØa‚àíVk,ùíØa]|subscript‚Üíùëòdelimited-[]subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscript‚Üíùëòdelimited-[]subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëésubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëé\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}% }\right]\right|\leq\left|\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}-V% _{k,\mathcal{T}_{a}}\right]\right|| roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | ‚â§ | roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] |

    In fact, we know that, using the Bellman Operator ùíØbsubscriptùíØùëè\mathcal{T}_{b}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, if we are improving the policy at the same time, the state value function Vk,ùíØbsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëèV_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT will converge to the action value function Qk,ùíØbsubscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèQ_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as the policy get better. So, for optimal actions we will have :

    limk‚Üí‚àû[Qk,ùíØb‚àíVk,ùíØb]=0,subscript‚Üíùëòdelimited-[]subscriptùëÑùëòsubscriptùíØùëèsubscriptùëâùëòsubscriptùíØùëè0\lim\limits_{k\to\infty}\left[Q_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}-V_{k,\mathcal{T}_{b}}% \right]=0,roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ‚Üí ‚àû end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = 0 ,

    i.e. also using ùíØasubscriptùíØùëé\mathcal{T}_{a}caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can say surely for optimal actions :
